hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ECR_REGISTRY_URL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Indicates the location of the elastic container registry (ECR) where the docker image to be pulled resides. Combined with the POM_VERSION, this value also serves to identify the docker image in the registry.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: POM_VERSION
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The maven version number for the war file the docker image being pulled is based on. Combined with ECR_URL, this value serves to identify the docker image in the registry..

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: EC2_INSTANCE_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The id of the EC2 instance that will be running the container based on the docker image wrapping the newly built war file. Example: i-099de1c5407493f9b

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: PROFILE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Determines which environment/landscape the deployment is for

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
DOCKER_TAG="${ECR_REGISTRY_URL}/${POM_ARTIFACTID}:${POM_VERSION}"
# Execute a docker command using the aws cli on the application host to run a container against the new image in the registry # DOCUMENTATION: # http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/ssm/send-command.html # http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/walkthrough-cli.html run_command_id=$(/usr/local/aws/bin/aws ssm send-command \ --instance-ids "${EC2_INSTANCE_ID}" \ --document-name "AWS-RunShellScript" \ --comment "Running shell script to pull and run container against a new docker image for hello-world" \ --parameters commands=" if [ -n '\$(docker ps --filter name=hwcontainer -q)' ]; then docker rm -f hwcontainer; fi && EXISTING_IMAGE_ID= docker images | grep -P '${ECR_REGISTRY_URL}/${POM_ARTIFACT_ID}\s+${POM_VERSION}' | sed -r -n 's/[[:blank:]]+/ /gp' | cut -d ' ' -f 3 && if [ -n '\${EXISTING_IMAGE_ID}' ]; then docker rmi ${EXISTING_IMAGE_ID}; fi &&
eval \$(aws ecr get-login --profile ${PROFILE}) && docker run -d -p 8181:8080 --restart unless-stopped --name hwcontainer ${DOCKER_TAG}" \ --profile ${PROFILE} \ --output text \ --query "Command.CommandId")
